div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 14:52 pm CDT

div.span: A 30 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms. Partly sunny, with a high near 65. Northeast wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.
A 30 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms before 7pm. Increasing clouds, with a low around 42. North wind 5 to 10 mph.
Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming sunny, with a high near 71. Light and variable wind becoming west 5 to 10 mph in the afternoon.

Overview & Purpose
The purpose of this guide is to provide answers and expectations during our time of distance learning.
Our hope is to maintain academic rigor while providing a sense of stability to our students and their families.

Welch Public School Statement

h3.a: Mandatory School Shut Down - Meals Plan

div.p:
Clarification to the school meal program for the next two weeks.
Beginning Monday, March 23, WPS will be serving lunch from 10 to 11:30 as a grab and go meal through the circle drive in front of the cafeteria. These meals are free to all students, no one will be charged. Please take advantage of this meal program during this time. Please call the school between 1 and 3 on March 18 and let us know if you will . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Mandatory School Shut Down - Meals Plan

div.p:
Â
Â March 12, 2020
Â
Parents/Guardians,Â
Â
As we gain information and awareness about coronavirus, Welch Public School would like to assure you we are working with the State Department of Education and local health department to help ensure that we have a safe and healthy learning environment for our students. We have included a letter from the State Department of Education on . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about WPS Coronavirus Guidelines

div.p:
Dear District and School Leaders,
The spread of the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) and its emergence in the U.S. are prompting questions about its potential impact on workplaces, communities and schools. The Oklahoma State Department of Education (OSDE) is closely monitoring this rapidly developing situation and is preparing regular updates for schools. . . .
